snippet: A proposal to provide essential drugs free to hospital patients would fill a gap in health care at India’s state-owned hospitals, many of which require patients to buy their own drugs.
abstract: India is completing proposal to provide hundreds of essential drugs free to patients in government-run hospitals and clinics at a cost of nearly $5 billion over five years; proposal would fill a gap in health care at the hospitals, many of which require patients to buy their own drugs.

byline.contributor: Katie Thomas contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: A proposal to provide essential drugs free to hospital patients would fill a gap in health care at India’s state-owned hospitals, many of which require patients to buy their own drugs.

headline.seo: India May Provide Free Drugs at State-Run Hospitals
headline.main: India Weighs Providing Free Drugs at State-Run Hospitals
headline.print_headline: India Weighs Providing Free Drugs at State-Run Hospitals
